body:
**Bug Report**

What happened:

When I create a new cluster I will have osd.0, osd.1 and osd.2.

If I delete an OSD pod I will have an OSD with a new id, ie osd.3, when the new OSD pod starts.
The original OSD will be marked as down.

What you expected to happen:

OSD ids would remain constant.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): `CentOS Linux release 7.4.1708 (Core)`
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): `3.10.0-693.17.1.el7.x86_64`
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: On premise Nutanix VM.
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): `v0.7.0-168.gce12fcc`
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"9", GitVersion:"v1.9.5", GitCommit:"f01a2bf98249a4db383560443a59bed0c13575df", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-03-19T15:50:45Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"9", GitVersion:"v1.9.5", GitCommit:"f01a2bf98249a4db383560443a59bed0c13575df", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-03-19T15:50:45Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): `Kubespray`

***

Example:

1. New cluster:
```
# kubectl -n rook-ceph exec -it rook-ceph-mon0-vn6br -- ceph -s
  cluster:
    id:     db4bb89d-3560-40c6-9020-10af945b6d5a
    health: HEALTH_OK
 
  services:
    mon: 3 daemons, quorum rook-ceph-mon0,rook-ceph-mon1,rook-ceph-mon2
    mgr: rook-ceph-mgr0(active)
    osd: 3 osds: 3 up, 3 in
 
  data:
    pools:   0 pools, 0 pgs
    objects: 0 objects, 0 bytes
    usage:   3078 MB used, 1492 GB / 1495 GB avail
    pgs:
``` 
***
```
# kubectl -n rook-ceph exec -it rook-ceph-mon0-vn6br -- ceph osd tree
ID CLASS WEIGHT  TYPE NAME                              STATUS REWEIGHT PRI-AFF 
-1       1.46036 root default                                                   
-2       0.48679     host host1                         
 0   hdd 0.48679         osd.0                              up  1.00000 1.00000 
-5       0.48679     host host2                       
 1   hdd 0.48679         osd.1                              up  1.00000 1.00000 
-7       0.48679     host host3                       
 2   hdd 0.48679         osd.2                              up  1.00000 1.00000
```
 ***

2. After deleting OSD pod
```
# kubectl -n rook-ceph exec -it rook-ceph-mon0-vn6br -- ceph -s
   cluster:
     id:     db4bb89d-3560-40c6-9020-10af945b6d5a
     health: HEALTH_WARN
             1 osds down
  
   services:
     mon: 3 daemons, quorum rook-ceph-mon0,rook-ceph-mon1,rook-ceph-mon2
     mgr: rook-ceph-mgr0(active)
     osd: 4 osds: 3 up, 4 in
  
   data:
     pools:   0 pools, 0 pgs
     objects: 0 objects, 0 bytes
     usage:   4107 MB used, 1989 GB / 1993 GB avail
     pgs:     
 
# kubectl -n rook-ceph exec -it rook-ceph-mon0-vn6br -- ceph osd tree
 ID CLASS WEIGHT  TYPE NAME                              STATUS REWEIGHT PRI-AFF 
 -1       1.94714 root default                                                   
 -2       0.48679     host host1                       
  0   hdd 0.48679         osd.0                              up  1.00000 1.00000 
 -5       0.48679     host host2                       
  1   hdd 0.48679         osd.1                              up  1.00000 1.00000 
 -7       0.97357     host host3                       
  2   hdd 0.48679         osd.2                            down  1.00000 1.00000 
  3   hdd 0.48679         osd.3                              up  1.00000 1.00000
```

***
```
# udevadm info /dev/sdb | awk -F= '{ print $1 }'
P: /devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:04.0/virtio1/host2/target2:0:1/2:0:1:0/block/sdb
```

milestone.description:
* Multiple storage backends
  * Full design
  * Refactor code base and repositories to enable
  * Consider support for Minio, potentially early support for other backends time permitting
* Switch CRDs to API Aggregation
* Run on arbitrary PVs
* Remove Rook API and CLI
* Migrate CI and release pipelines to a solution hosted by the CNCF
* Run with Least Privileged and possibly without privileged containers
* Shutdown / restart issues
* Support Kubernetes 1.7+ only
* Ceph features and improvements
  * Adding/removing disks (lifecycle issues, failures, 1 OSD per pod, etc.)
  * Placement group balancer support (ceph-mgr module)
  * Mon reliability (restarts, failing over too fast, ip changes, etc.)
  * Mimic support

title: osd id changes after osd pod deletion
